channel.title: Kicksecure KVM - Security Focused Linux - 15.0.0.7.1
channel.description:
Kicksecure is a security-hardened, non-anonymous Linux distribution.
This is the first release of Kicksecure KVM.
Testers wanted!
**Initial Homepage:**
https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Kicksecure
**Download:**
https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Kicksecure/KVM#Download_Kicksecure_.E2.84.A2
**Available platforms:**
**Documentation:**
There is not much documentation available for Kicksecure yet. A lot documentation valid for Whonix also applies for Kicksecure but only advanced users know what applies and what does not. A Google Summer of Documentation (GSoD) project to create Kicksecure documentation is currently ongoing, see https://forums.whonix.org/t/document-installation-and-setup-of-the-new-security-focused-hardened-debian-linux-distribution-selected-by-whonix-for-season-of-docs-2019/7887.
**Possible future available platforms:**
* [Installation](https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Dev/Installation_from_Repository) on Debian buster hosts using the `kicksecure-cli` package initially tested by developer, call for wider testing upcoming. * [Work on Whonix-Host](https://forums.whonix.org/tags/whonix-host) recently [started](https://phabricator.whonix.org/tag/whonix-host/). Developers succeeded in creating a bootable live ISO which can be used live and optionally installed to the hard drive. Anyone welcome to contribute a Kicksecure ISO.
**Version Number:**
`15.0.0.7.1`
In future, new Kicksecure KVM images will be released at the same time new Whonix images are released. This is because Kicksecure and Whonix share a common base of source code. Whonix is based on Kicksecure. This also explains why the first release of Kicksecure already comes with a high version number.
**Miscellaneous:**
* [Kicksecure initial announcement](https://forums.whonix.org/t/kicksecure-security-focused-linux-distribution-based-on-debian-in-development-feedback-wanted/5943) * https://forums.whonix.org/t/sudo-apt-get-install-whonix-part-i-distro-morphing/2346 * https://forums.whonix.org/t/sudo-apt-get-install-whonix-part-ii-whonix-packages-for-debian-hosts/2348 * It is indeed non-ideal that Kicksecure is hosted on whonix.org. Ideally it would be migrated to its own domain name `kicksecure.com`. Due to lack of project resources (such as [lack of a volunteer webmaster](https://forums.whonix.org/t/whonix-org-webmaster-fortasse-stepped-down/5019)) for the time being, Kicksecure will be hosted on whonix.org.
----
Please donate!
https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Donate
Investors!
https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Investors

item.title: Kicksecure KVM - Security Focused Linux - 15.0.0.7.1
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
Kicksecure is a security-hardened, non-anonymous Linux distribution.

This is the first release of Kicksecure KVM.

Testers wanted!

Initial Homepage:

Whonix – 22 Nov 19

Kicksecure

Kicksecure ™ is a security-hardened Debian based Linux distribution that provides better protection from malware.

Download:

Whonix – 23 Nov 19

Kicksecure/KVM

Kicksecure ™ for KVM with XFCE Desktop Environment

Available platforms:

Documentation:

There is not much documentation available for Kicksecure yet. A lot documentation valid for Whonix also applies for Kicksecure but only advanced users know what applies and what does not. A Google Summer of Documentation (GSoD) project to create Kicksecure documentation is currently ongoing, see "Document Installation and Setup of the New Security-focused Hardened Debian Linux Distribution" selected by Whonix for Season of Docs 2019.

Possible future available platforms:

  • Installation on Debian buster hosts using the kicksecure-cli package initially tested by developer, call for wider testing upcoming.
  • Work on Whonix-Host recently started. Developers succeeded in creating a bootable live ISO which can be used live and optionally installed to the hard drive. Anyone welcome to contribute a Kicksecure ISO.

Version Number:

15.0.0.7.1

In future, new Kicksecure KVM images will be released at the same time new Whonix images are released. This is because Kicksecure and Whonix share a common base of source code. Whonix is based on Kicksecure. This also explains why the first release of Kicksecure already comes with a high version number.

Miscellaneous:

  • Kicksecure initial announcement
  • 'sudo apt-get install whonix' Part I / Distro-Morphing
  • 'sudo apt-get install whonix' Part II / Whonix Packages for Debian Hosts
  • It is indeed non-ideal that Kicksecure is hosted on whonix.org. Ideally it would be migrated to its own domain name kicksecure.com. Due to lack of project resources (such as lack of a volunteer webmaster) for the time being, Kicksecure will be hosted on whonix.org.

Please donate!

Whonix – 16 Nov 19

Donate

PayPal, Bitcoin, Monero, Bank Wire

Investors!

Whonix – 18 Oct 19

Investors

Investing in Whonix

Read full topic
